column4: can I install ubuntu with a other kernel then the one supplied on my CD?
did you look in apt/synaptic?
I simply did apt-cache search linux-image
use kernel as the search term, see what that brings up
LadyNikon: rebooting and going to take a look
LadyNikon: I just have a 2.6.12-9 kernel.... and with my network doesn't work.... I added a static entry in /etc/network/interfaces and run ifup eth0.... that works without a problem
LadyNikon: but when I try to ping my gateway (same network, netmask is good and my network address is good) then I get distination host unreacheable
make sure it's not listening on eth1 or something
then ifup eth0 would fail.....
I have done this many many times on Debian on several servers.....
then you know more about it than i. i was only suggesting ideas
normally con fiurating network is a snap for me.....
maybe a package reconfigure could help *shrugs*
well.. I din't know ubuntu..  and I just see a awefull lot of things are loaded I don't know of
i dont know what package that would be though
no, shrugs is where you shrug
I am lost.... maby I should ask my gf to shrug me?!?!
its where you raise your shoulders a bit as a gesture of not being sure...cant think how else to explain it
hehehe
understand?
I'll ask my GF :)
